ygData.subject: Re: any human necromancers out there?
ygData.msgSnippet: Just click on your pet from time to time, it ll show a target hitbar like normal.  Its also good to have a feel for what your pet s general hitpoints are.
ygData.messageBody:
Just click on your pet from time to time, it'll show a target hitbar
like normal. Its also good to have a "feel" for what your pet's general
hitpoints are. Like having half hits means that your skel can probably take
X more hits froma spiderling. It takes time but you figure it out well
enough.

Malark

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vince [mailto:gameport@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 2:36 PM
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] any human necromancers out there?
>
>
> From: "Vince" <gameport@...>
>
> How do you keep a watch on your skeleton's life? I can never
> tell how close
> he is to buying the farm, yet again.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Shadow Panther [mailto:shdwpanther@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 11:07 AM
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] any human necromancers out there?
>
>
> From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
>
>
> 'fraid you wont find much around Qeynos. The best thing
> for you to do
> is make a trek to Freeport. That's undead haven there, I
> swear. You've got
> numerous little ruins outside, plus Befallen (watch out for
> horrible trains
> & that damn Ghoul & Ice Boned) you can put that Ward Undead
> to use. Beware
> of fizzles, however.
>
> As for around Qeynos.. eh.. Karanas is the best place.
> Just kill the
> grizzlies and spidies. It'll take longer, but you're almost
> guranteed the
> experiance from them so long as you're not double timed.
> Just remember to
> smack 'em with poisen, maybe Clinging Darkness and/or Fear,
> and leave enough
> mana for a Mend Bones or Gate. :-) You're not going to get
> much more around
> Qeynos. I left the place at level 10 for Freeport, got 56
> gold in three
> days there, a greater light stone, two magical (Cut-Throat Insignia)
> rings..... and lost level 10. *grin* Even the Orc Centurian
> around the
> entrance to the city of Freeport carries leggings at times,
> which you can
> sell for gold.
>
> Freeport is nice, but very dangerous. Those damn young
> kodiaks hate you
> and will attack you on sight. They're pretty tough at this level,
> especially with a giant spider or two in tow. Both of which
> roam around the
> immediate area of Freeport, one zone from the city. Good
> exp, just watch
> your back. Also, just because a zombie /con`s blue doesn't
> mean it's an
> easy kill. I made it out of a fight against two of those
> with a sliver of
> mana and life. Granted, I had no pet at the time, but geeze
> they hurt.
>
> Ghouls and the Ice Boned Skeleton takes magical weapons &
> spells to hurt
> it. Your ward undead can kill it the Ice Boned if somebody else is
> distracting it so you can get all of them off, but not
> face-to-face as it
> will stun you repeatedly. Ward Undead on the Ghoul is a
> waste of mana.
> It'll resist virtually every one of them. Don't -- Fight --
> The -- Ghoul
> :-)
>
> Also, the desert is a great place. The Giant Scarab
> Beetles are very
> easy kills -- I can sit and meditate while my skeleton beats
> the snot out of
> them (just remember to poisen them & keep a watch on your
> skelly's life) --
> and gives okay experiance. Zombies roam the desert, as well
> as skeletons.
> /con _everything_ first, especially the skeletons. Many of
> them will /con
> red to you.
>
> Good luck. Qeynos at level 10 is incredibly boring...
>
> ~Mysk
>
> > From: Sagi Shechter <sagis@...>
> >
> > Can anyone give some recommendations about where to go on
> 10th lvl, as a
> > human necro in qeynos?
> > For the last 3 levels i've been in west karana, and i'm
> looking for better
> > places to hunt, as the xp and the loot i get in karana
> > from the creatures i can handle there ( mostly giant spiders, giant
> > beetles,lions , the occasional grizzly ) , is quite bad.
> > >From the times i've been to black burrow, it looks that
> place is just
> > impossible, because of all of the people that hang around
> there all of the
> > time, pulling train after train..
> > Is there any undead hunting site near qeynos, besides the
> ruins in the
> > hills? I realy want to put my ward-undead to use..
> >
> > death to all,
> >
> > Trenzorian/Tunare
> >
> >
> > If we aren't supposed to eat animals , why are they made of meat?
> >
> >
> >
